content.description: Start with hands in the decent crack to the right of the arete.   Get your feet on then compress and up the arete.

This challenging slab problem takes a line up the center of the smooth-looking face on smallish holds.

A thin start gives way to easier slab moves once past the technical first five feet. Best done when the temps are cooler to ensure success, and maybe give it a good brushing as it's often quite chalked and greasy due to it's location.
content.location: Center of the east face (facing the road).

content.description:
Just right of

Hensel Face

(V0) are several scoops of unknown origin which make a fun outing to the top of this boulder, as well as being the easiest way off the boulder that doesn't involve jumping.

Worth doing more than once, this is a fun one to do and to do with one hand, and with no hands, and with your eyes closed and with your eyes closed with no hands - well you get the idea. Kids seem to enjoy this as well.
content.location: Right side of the East face (facing the road).

content.description: Start with hands on good holds, then move into the scoop and high gastons from which the crux moves allow the rounded mantle finish to be reached.
content.protection: Pads and spotter to keep you out of the bush

content.description:
That's not V1!

You might be thinking that as you look at it, but no, it really is. The combination of just enough holds and a series of enjoyable moves make this a problem that's deserving of more attention.

Start under the bulge and monzo-navigate your way upwards to a hidden hold, a standard mantle finish being the topout.
content.location: Backside (west face) of the boulder; faces away from the road.

content.description:
Located just right of

Slabmaster

is this standardized friction test. A decent problem if in the area but the nearby

Intersection Boulder, Left

is a better problem if that sort of thing interests you.
content.location: Center of the East face (facing the road).

content.description:
Footwork and balace will see you through as you bearhug and highstep your way up the blunt arete left of

Slabmaster

. The problem can be started from either side of the blunt arete and the difficulties ease the higher you get.
content.location: Left edge of the East face (facing the road).
